title: Is IFSI an acronym or an abbreviation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dear M. Anonymous, We already know IFSI is at least an abbreviation (all acronyms are abbreviations), but your real question is, “Can this qualify for the vaunted title of acronym?” There are multiple definitions for IFSI, so which one is yours? I cannot answer your question intelligently without knowing the context of this. Is it a government agency (from which country?), a company (again, which country or product), or something else entirely? See the list here.  However, since you have not told us where you saw this string of letters, we cannot know how the owners of your “IFSI” pronounce it. They might pronounce it as a word (IF-see), in which case it qualifies as an ACRONYM. Some well-known acronyms are NASA, radar (formerly “RADAR”), ASCII, NOAA, and scuba (originally “SCUBA,” an acronym for “self-contained underwater breathing apparatus”). However, IFSI could also be one of those alphabet soup creations that their owners spell out letter by letter when pronouncing it (“I - F- S - I”), in which case it is an ABBREVIATION but not an acronym. If it isn’t already confusing, every acronym is also an abbreviation. The umbrella term is “abbreviation,” and acronyms are a subset of abbreviations. An acronym must be pronounced as a word. That is the only thing that differentiates the two labels.  Here is a tidbit about the acronym “radar” from Wikipedia: “Radar was developed secretly for military use by several nations in the period before and during World War II. A key development was the cavity magnetronin the UK, which allowed the creation of relatively small systems with sub-meter resolution. The term RADAR was coined in 1940 by the United States Navy as an acronym for RAdio Detection And Ranging or RAdio Direction And Ranging. The term radar has since entered English and other languages as a common noun, losing all capitalization.” —Sarah M. 8/10/2018 — I answered a truly similar question about IFFSI last night, so — apologies to my readers — this answer is an almost total ripoff of that one with minor changes. PRO TIP: Spelling counts, even for anonymous questions about acronyms …  QUESTION: Is IFSI an acronym or abbreviation?
